element.name: Swords Castle by Windsockers, Multi-cache (1.5/1.5)

description.center: The Cache is located in The grounds of Swords Castle

element.long-description:
Swords Castle is situated in the centre of the ancient town of Swords about 15 Km north of Dublin City.It is the former residence of the Archbishop of Dublin and it is the only fortified residence of the Archbishop to survive in a reasonable state today. The buildings that make up the castle form a rough pentagon enclosing an area of approximately 0.5 Ha with a perimeter wall of 305 meters.The castle was built over a period of 400 years starting before 1200 AD.
Castle Opening times are:
Monday to Thursday. 10am to 12.00 noon and 1.00pm to 4.00pm
Friday. 10am to 12.00 noon and 1.00pm to 3.00pm
Weekends. Closed Weekends
The Cache
This is a two stage multicache starting at the above coordinates.
Near the starting point you’ll see a plaque on the ground with some dates on, you’ll need to convert the months to numerical form then:
Take the first number and add it to the third number call this A.
Take the third and sixth number and add them together call this B. Take the second number add this to the third number and add this to the sixth number call this C.
Take the first number then add it to the sixth number call this D.
The coordinates of the final cache are then given by N 53 27.DC3 W 006 13.1AB
Take note of the park opening times below for this cache
Park Opening Times
Nov. to Jan. 10.00 am - 5.00 pm
Feb. to Mar. 10.00 am - 6.00 pm
April 10.00 am - 7.00 pm
May 10.00 am - 8.00 pm
Jun. to Aug. 10.00 am - 9.00 pm
Sept. 10.00 am - 8.00 pm
Oct. 10.00 am - 7.00 pm
The Windsockers

ul.li:
2010-06-14T19:00:00Z : Found it by RoobyDoo
Back in Swords, this time on holiday. This time round, was able to spend some time looking for the cache. Fond the well camflouged cache between passing muggles. Dropped off coin. TFTC RD

2010-06-14T16:30:21Z : Found it by Fitzet
Tried for this twice a couple of weeks ago with no joy. Went home and read the logs and hints and decided I knew exactly where it was. Brought a bespoke 'cache retrieval tool' (bent coat hanger) as I believed it must be shoved away out of reach. Spent 30 minutes up to my shoulder trying to get at it. Still nothing. Then got a text from the other half of fitzet saying cache was found today. Realised that spot I was searching in was undisturbed (except by me) so had a rethink. Found it right away. No need for pokey tool. GAH! the moral of the story is just read the hint!!!!!! Took a coin. SL TFTC

2010-05-15T19:00:00Z : Found it by Alastair74
Found while spending the day in Dublin for the WWFM with Wildfowler TFTC

2010-05-15T19:00:00Z : Found it by wildfowler
Found on a caching weekend around Dublin with Alastair74! TNLNSL TFTC

2010-04-25T19:00:00Z : Write note by abra123cadabra
Thanks for confirming that the cache is still in place. Three of us searched but apparently not in the right spot. I noticed that the Colorado is a bit off when it comes to finding GZ. We'll extend the search next time around.

2008-09-27T19:00:00Z : Found it by Kersti.com
Found with jme1979 on a lovely day. Handy place to sit and sign the log and a gorgeous spot, I was well impressed with this castle and would love to come back when the building work is finished. As an added bonus there was a small market just nearby where we got some absolutely yummy cakes!

Additional Waypoints

FLRR5K - Final Location
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___
